result.execSummary:
The defendant Richard J. Scott was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Richard J. Scott is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Richard J. Scott was found guilty of Repeated Sexual Assault of Same Child (At Least 3 Violations of 1st or 2nd Degree Sexual Assault), a class C felony, Wisconsin Statutes 948.025(1)(e).
  • Richard J. Scott was found guilty of Possession of Child Pornography, a class D felony, Wisconsin Statutes 948.12(1m).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

superMiscConds.notes:
Obey all of the rules and regulations of supervising probation agent.  
*  Pay supervision fees.  
*  Pay all court costs including all applicable surcharges.  
*  Pay $500 surcharge for (1) image of pronography.   
*  Submit to a DNA sample (unless previously provided) and pay surcharge.    
*  If unpaid financial obligations remain at discharge or revocation, civil judgment to be entered. 
May not have contact with victims or their parents.  DOC shall promptly notify the Court of any new arrest or criminal charge made against the deft.

Minutes:  Clerk/T. Lema.  ADA Emily Trigg appeared for the State.  Deft appeared in custody w/Atty Terry Rose.  Victim rights compliance.  Sentencing arguments made.  

Count 4 - deft sentenced to 24yrs WSP; initial confinement of 9yrs followed by 15yrs of ES.  See conditions.  Credit for 1293 days.

Count 7 - deft sentenced to 4yrs WSP consecutive; initial confinemen tof 1yr followed by 3yrs of ES.

Deft not eligible for CIP or SAP.

Minutes:  Clerk/T. Lema.  ADA Burgyone appeared for the State.  Deft appeared in custody w/Atty Terry Rose.  Case not resolved.  Ludwig hrg held.  Deft rejects offer.  Arguments heard on deft's motion for adjournment of the June 8th trial date so the deft can be evaluated is argued by the parties; motion is denied.  JS to remain on for 6/8/15 @ 9am.  Arguments heard on the Daubert issue.  Court will w/hold ruling for 48 hours to allow defense counsel to supplement the record.  Case re-called.  Deft wishes to accept the plea offer.  Deft pleads guilty to counts 4 & 7; found guilty by the Court.  PSI ordered.  Sentencing set for 7/6/15 @ 3pm.  Remaining counts are dismissed on State's motion.

Minutes:  Clerk/T. Lema.  ADA Emily Trigg appeared for the State.  Deft appeared in custody w/Atty Terry Rose.  New offer relayed today which is substantially different that the offer that was relayed last week.  Deft would like a few days to think over the offer.  FPT adj to 5/26/15 @ 9:45am

Minutes:  NO RECORD TAKEN.  Clerk/T. Lema.  ADA Emily Trigg appeared for the State.  Atty Terry Rose appeared on behalf of deft.  Deft not transported from the KCJ.  FPT adj to 5/21/15 @ 11am due to ongoing jury trial

Minutes:  Clerk/T. Lema.  ADA Emily Trigg appeared for the State.  Deft appeared in custody w/Atty Terry Rose.  Arguments heard on the deft's motion to dismiss.  Deft's motion to dismiss is denied.  Defense moves for a reduction in bond - requests a signature bond.  State objects to any bond modification.  Deft's bond reduction motion is denied.  Defense states the deft will be waiving his right to a prelim hrg.  Deft waives his right to a prelim hrg.  Deft bound over for trial.  Court will conduct the arraignment at the same time as of the FPT which is 3/26/15 @ 11am.  JS 4/13/15 @ 9am.  ADA Trigg notes for the record she may be in trial in branch 8.  Information shall be filed w/in 30 days.  Date of 2/17/15 removed from the Intake calendar

Attorney Emily Trigg appeared for the State. Def. appeared (in custody) with Atty. Terry Rose. Clerk LE. Case was scheduled for preliminary hearing this morning. Joint request by parties to adjourn preliminary hearing, as there is a motion to dismiss scheduled this afternoon in Br. 3. Time limits waived by def. and tolled by court. Motion hearing on 2-10-15 @ 1:00pm. Status conference on 2-17-15 @ 1:00pm to check status of preliminary hearing. Bond continued.
to Dismiss & Bond Motion - filed by Atty Terry Rose

Attorney Emily Trigg appeared for the State. Def. appeared (in custody) with Atty. Terry Rose. Clerk LE. Case was scheduled for preliminary hearing this morning. State has filed amended complaint. Atty. Rose moves to dismiss complaint. Court denies motion. Atty. Rose requests adjournment based on amended criminal complaint. Court grants adjournment. Time limits tolled. Preliminary hearing rescheduled to 2-10-15 @ 10:30am. Bond continued.
